page.title: 10Earning a living in Coates
page.content: THIS GRID AREA IS DOMINATED BY THE ARABLE FARM LAND THAT SURROUNDS THE RURAL COMMUNITIES OF COATES AND NEIGHBOURING EASTREA. ONLY A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF MEN STILL EARN THEIR LIVING IN FARMING AND RELATED JOBS. MANY WOMAN FIND SEASONAL CASUAL WORK ON THE LAND. A GREATER NUMBER ARE SELF EMPLOYED IN SKILED MANUAL PURSUITS SUCH AS BUILDING, TRUCK OWNER/DRIVERS> MOST FAMILIES STILL EXPECT THE MAN TO EARN ALL OR MOST OF THE INCOME, AND MOST MEN USE COATES AND EASTREA AS DORMITORIES, COMMUTING TO THE LARGER OFFICES AND FACTORIES OF PETERBOROUGH AND WHITTLESEY. JOBS ARE MAINLY EITHER PROFESSIONAL (TEACHERS, CIVIL SERVANTS, ETC) OR SKILLED MANUAL JOBS (TV ENGINEERS, RAILWAY WORKERS, ETC).
